name: The GEM Hotel SoHo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been to New york several times before and always staying midtown, we decided on a change! This hotel is perfect in everyway, the area is fab, within walking distance to all the downtown areas. The F and V subway lines are just across the road so everything in the whole of New York is easily accessable. The staff on the desk were very friendly (such a change for us, usually the most we get is a grunt in midtown!!...oops!!) The room itself was good, very comfy bed, flat screen plasma, ipod dock, free wifi internet, nice bed linen, clean bathroom, fridge and microwave!! We enjoyed Sugar for brekkie and the italian in Wholefoods was pretty awesome too!! Love, love, loved it!!!
reviews.title: We loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, so it's not really in SoHo, but I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of this Gem hotel, particularly at the lowlow price we booked it for online. The rooms are small but big enough for two not-petite people; the amenities are basic but what's there is very good (so there's no cafe or room service or you do get Wolfgang Puck coffee for your in-room percolater); and the reception and housekeeping staff were universally cheerful, welcoming and happy to help. Plus, the bed was so comfortable we actually asked what kind it was so we can get one for home!
reviews.title: Top value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the location is actually better for tourists than being in the middle of SoHo, because you're so close to all the great downtown neighbourhoods - we could easily walk to SoHo, Nolita and East and West villages for drinks and dinner every night - plus there's a Wholefoods supermarket over the road, it's close to at least two subway stations and if you're really feeling lazy there are bars and restaurants within the same block (I heartily recommend trying a knish from the place next door if you need a stodgy hangover cure).
reviews.title: perfect surroundings

reviews.text: everything was perfect from the location to the service to the well designed room. the staff was pleasant and helpful in every way. the room was clean and appeared to be recently renovated with large flat screen tv's and an incredibly comfortable bed. this is the perfect spot for easy access to shopping, dining, drinking and exploring. i would definitley stay again.
reviews.title: Amazing staff and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are small but they are neat and well maintained. Room size is not really an issue anyway since hotel is smack in the border of the Lower East Side and East Village and there's so much to do. Any issue with room size is more than compensated by excellent staff and the fantastic location. The staff were just wonderful - smart, very friendly and went out of their way to help. I would stay here again, tomorrow.
reviews.title: best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: smallish room but very clean.helpful,personable staff.lots of good stuff nearby
reviews.title: very helpful staff,clean room,decent price

reviews.text: Terrific location. Very clean room that appeared to have been updated recently, including crisp linens, very clean bathroom, flat screen TV. Friendly/helpful staff. Small room, but its NYC - you're only in the room to sleep/shower.
reviews.title: great value for the dollar

reviews.text: I stayed 2 nights at the Gem Soho (not really anywhere near SoHo) 13 &14 March. I was in NYC for a music festival that was held 2 blocks down the street. What can I say. I spent $145 a night in Manhatten. GREAT DEAL! Lovely room, small, but expected. CLEAN. Incredible front of house staff who were funny, kind, helpful and seemed to really enjoy working at this hotel. We had a room facing the park, street noise wasn't anymore than I would expect from a hotel on a street as busy as Houston. You can walk anywhere from here. Very convienient to subway stops.
reviews.title: Insanely good price- great location-wonderful staff-will stay again and again

reviews.text: *Only complaint, they ran out of coffee packets for in room service and only had decaf. ummm, nope, that wasn't so cool. No coffee for the whole stay. Though plenty of great cafes within blocks.
reviews.title: Good Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also wish the drapes could have closed to add more room darkening. The pull down shade didn't quite black out. I am not complaining though. I will stay there again and again for the good rates, the wonderful staff, immaculate rooms, and great location. GOOD JOB GUYS! (also if you are there visit the Local 269 a great pub just a couple blocks away at 269 E. Houston. You will be made to feel at home here.)
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: My room was indeed very small, but had everything I needed. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet given the location, with a very very comfortable bed. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the location is absolutely perfect, being Lower East Side but spitting distance from SoHo and the East Village. The Gem isn't fancy but it's good for the price, and it's hard to find affordable hotels in NYC.
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.text: Unreal location! Right in the heart of Soho, walk to Little Italy, China town etc. The hotel rooms are very chic and larger than 90% of roms in NYC...great staff and close to everything we were looking for. I was in-town for a concert and spent 3 nights here and all I can say is WOW. The hotel looked brand new, had the ambiance of a W but with unmistakable feel of a B&B...unique combo and combined with the location it truly is a GEM. I am planning another trip to NYC in the next couple of months and will look no futher than the GEM (and no I do not work for the Hotel; I am a real customer who was truly impressed and i feel I need to rave about a hotel when i have been blown away). Also, forgot to mention the service; we arrived late, after 1am, and received a warm greeting by the night auditor. He suggested a few great places in the area and everyone was spot on. The day staff was equally as helpful and had maps already made up for the key points we wanted to visit. What more can I say, I LOVED THIS HOTEL! A+ to The GEM...I will be back...keep up the good work!
reviews.title: Best boutique hotel in NYC!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Picked the Gem because of the location and the reviews here on TA. Super value for New York, VERY helpful staff. Small room was quite, newer furnishing and well maintained. Close to subway and bus with plenty of eating and drinking establishments near by. You really can't go wrong choosing this GEM.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Newyorkcity is definitely one of my favorite cities in the world, and this hotel goes hand by hand with the city, except you can sleep until late
reviews.title: Five Stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Gem after seeing reviews on trip advisor and because it seemed to be the cheapest hotel with decent reviews in New York! not that it's cheap mind, just that New York is horrifically expensive, even compared to London. And dont forget they clobber you for tax on everything too! The Gem though is a small hotel, and the service they give is excellent. Antony on the front desk was incredibly helpful in recomending places to eat (Sugar diner 2 blocks away on Allen and East Houston is brilliant food, and open 24/7, pefect for breakfast and late night cake!). The rooms are small, but that didn't bother us too much as we were out most of the time. They have free wireless internet, Flat screen TVs, coffee percolators in each room, and although they don't have a restaurant they are happy for you to have food ordered up to the room from any takeout. The location was good too, so much is within walking distance, and the metro is close too. It isn't actually in SoHo, it's really on the edge of the Lower East Side, but the main shops of SoHo are only 10 mins walk away, little Italy and Chinatown is 5 mins walk, and Wahington Square Park is about 15 mins walk. We even walked down to the Finacial district to the WTC Site in about 30mins, although our feet hurt quite a bit after that- make sure you wear comfy shoes, there's a LOT of walking in New York! This wasn't the best hotel I've ever stayed in, but it was clean and comfortable and good value, which is what matters after all. They were also happy to keep our bags all day after checkout on our last day.
reviews.title: Great Value for New York

aka: The Gem Hotel-Soho, An Ascend Collection Hotel Hotel
description: Free Wifi. The GEM Hotel SoHo is ideally located in "your corner of the world." We provide a boutique atmosphere and offer our guests elegantly designed rooms with luxurious amenities.We are conveniently located in the neighborhood of SoHo and the Lower East Side. This trendy Manhattan neighborhood is filled with chic art galleries, night club hotspots, world-famous restaurants, shopping and more. Spend an afternoon strolling the local neighborhoods and attractions such as Nolita, Chinatown, Little Italy, Canal Street and New York University (NYU). You can admire the art galleries and upscale boutiques within SoHo, or enjoy the East Village's excellent cafes and restaurants. The Lower East Side, once a first stop for poor immigrants and crammed with crowded tenements, small shops and warehouses, is now home to chic restaurants and boutiques, and some of the city's coolest night clubs, bars and music venues.The GEM Hotel SoHo offers a wide array of amenities and services that add value. For no additional charge, guests can enjoy wired & wireless Internet access, premium bottled water, nightly turndown service with our signature pillow mist, and shoeshine and concierge services.All guest rooms are smoke-free and have flat-panel LCD televisions with HD programming, iPod docking stations, cordless telephones, paraben-free bath amenities, bath robes, down pillows, plush towels and Wolfgang Puck coffee. Standard room amenities include coffee makers, hair dryers, irons and ironing boards.While staying at The GEM Hotel SoHo, check out the GEMmine in the lobby to find what is happening in the neighborhood; sights, sounds, dining and attractions.
